results.title: Avustralyadan bir enstantane...
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Bayram Ocal and ACMI
results.brief_description: Bayram Ocal reflects on his many achievements since migrating to Australia in the late sixties, including contributing to the foundation of a Turkish Islamic society, an Islamic funeral service, a mosque and various Turkish language newspapers.

results.title: Yeni dunyam = My new world
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Yusuf Hazar and ACMI
results.brief_description: Migrating to Australia from Ankara, Turkey in 1978, Yusuf Hazar fondly looks back on the life he and his wife created for his six children. Feeling a deep sense of gratitude to his adopted country, Yusuf and his family are committed to helping out others in the community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Yusuf Hazar and ACMI

results.title: My second home
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Memet Gunes and ACMI
results.brief_description: Memet Gunes was one of the lucky few people in his village in Turkey to receive an education. When he migrated to Australia with his family he found a place full of possibility and opportunity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Memet Gunes and ACMI

results.title: Ithal Damat = Imported groom
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Huseyin Duman and ACMI
results.brief_description: Huseyin Damat left Turkey for Australia to meet and marry his wife. Although he was sad to leave his family behind, his journey here was an eventful one, especially when he discovered he was on the same flight as Swedish super group ABBA.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Huseyin Duman and ACMI

results.title: New life new country
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Fatma Coskun and ACMI
results.brief_description: Fatma Coskun came from a small village amongst the mountains of Corun. However, financial hardships drove her and her husband to Australia to start a new life. Despite a major setback at the beginning of their journey, Fatma and her family consider themselves very fortunate to have settled in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Fatma Coskun and ACMI
results.description: Fatma Coskun came from a small village amongst the mountains of Corun. However, financial hardships drove her and her husband to Australia to start a new life. Despite a major setback at the beginning of their journey, Fatma and her family consider themselves very fortunate to have settled in Australia.

results.title: Yeni hayat = New life
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Kenan Besiroglu and ACMI
results.brief_description: Kenan Besiroglu migrated to Australia with his wife and son in 1970. This is a story of hard work, perseverance and the promise of a new life.

results.title: A Place to live [Turkish version]
results.creator_credit: Stuart Glover, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Orbost Locals
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Learn about the town of Orbost through a diverse range of locals as they talk about why they love their town, their community and the surrounding environment. Meet Mick Colling, the publican of the Orbost Club Hotel, who is heavily involved in fundraising within his local community and in particular for Ronald McDonald House. Lachie Macalister, a ‘true’ local and over eighty years old, has lived and farmed in Orbost all his life, growing everything from potatoes to pumpkins and working the land with pigs and cattle. Heather Terrell is many things: a passionate gardener, volunteer and member of the local historical society. Liz Mitchell, a tree changer and small business owner who decided to move to Orbost because she loved the environment and wanted to raise her family in a rural region. Finally, there’s Sam Mitchell, an 18-year-old student known around town for the extraordinary machines he builds and rides.

results.title: YCDco : a story of community support
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: When the only service station in town was under threat of closure, seven local people got together and decided to do something positive about it. They formed the Yackandandah Community Development Company Pty Ltd - YCDCo. To build a new fuel outlet, a share offer was launched to the community and over $400,000 was raised. Now almost every one in Yackandandah is a shareholder and receives a dividend each year. But the most valuable dividends are not monetary. YCDco contributes funds to the local newspaper, is integral to the Yack Folk Festival and has funded many local schools, sports and community groups.

results.title: Malcolm McKinnon: 6 films for MAP at ACMI
results.brief_description: A collection of six short documentary films from an ongoing project between the filmmaker, Malcolm McKinnon, and small museums in the Wimmera farming region of Victoria. They comprise of local stories told by local people from such areas as Warracknabeal, Rainbow, Murtoa, Brim and Coromby.
